item.title: Let's create a Harvey Ball Progress Indicator using CSS
item.description: A few weeks ago, I worked on a feature for a web application. One small part of that feature was to display a progress indicator for a task. I decided to use something called Harvey Balls for this. These are my own requirements for the solutions: It should be simple. It should be written purely in CSS. It should be defined by CSS classes that can be applied to a single div or span element, turning it into a progress indicator.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: So, here I am. I reached my goals for 2022 in the final hours: Started a blog (✔️) Posted the first post (✔️) Accomplished my mission (✔️) No, no, no, I’m kidding. My mission is not accomplished yet. My mission has only just begun. My personal growth I always thought about this step, but I never dared to start “My own blog”. Here I am. My goals are pretty simple. They are focused mainly on my personal growth.
